Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2013 07:42PM kitty61 wrote: If you want a lymphedema sleeve that looks like a real tattoo...look at lymphediva.com and check out the Lotus Dragon compression sleeve. I have this along with 3 other women on our Dragon boat team. Moore than a few times people have asked where I got my tattoo done! And it goes along with out Dragon Boat Team...we are all breast cancer survivors! Dragon Dream Team is our name...beating breast cancer is our game! Paddles up!
Posts.Title: Decorative Sleeves kane744 CarolyniNewman

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2013 06:28PM kitty61 wrote: I have swelling in my right arm, cancer side bc. Attributed it to lymphedema, and my dr told me what size sleeve to buy. Then saw a vascular Dr and she wants an ultrasound tomorrow. Might be a blockage. We'll see. Not wearing the sleeve until we know. Still having trouble getting my blood numbers up and staying up. Have very few problems with A+A, and feel good. Is there any drug better than Afinitor to keep us going? Oral meds are so easy and less exhausting, at least for me.

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2013 11:14AM kitty61 wrote: K-Lo, This is a very interesting article.  I think everyone has their own idea about how to die. I've talked openly about it with friends and family, so they understand!  I will fight this horrible disease until I can't fight anymore, then I'll go into the after life screaming 'what a ride'.  Thank you Erma Bombeck for this quote.  It's my favorite!
